=âˆ’logâ¢c1+logâ¢âˆi=1npâ¢(ri|r1:iâˆ’1,z)âˆi=1npâ¢(ri|r1:iâˆ’1,zâˆ—).absentlogsubscriptğ‘1logsuperscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ‘Ÿ:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ‘Ÿ:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§\displaystyle=-\textrm{log}{c_{1}}+\textrm{log}\frac{\prod_{i=1}^{n}p(r_{i}|r_% {1:i-1},z)}{\prod_{i=1}^{n}p(r_{i}|r_{1:i-1},z^{*})}.= - log italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + log divide start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG . (32)

So we can get:

pâ¢(R,x1:iâˆ’1|z)=pâ¢(x1:iâˆ’1|R,z)â¢pâ¢(R|z)â‰ˆâˆi=1nOâ¢(1)â¢pâ¢(ri|r1:iâˆ’1,z)ğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘…ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘…ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘‚1ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ‘Ÿ:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§\displaystyle p(R,x_{1:i-1}|z)=p(x_{1:i-1}|R,z)p(R|z)\approx\prod_{i=1}^{n}O(1% )p(r_{i}|r_{1:i-1},z)italic_p ( italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z ) = italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_z ) italic_p ( italic_R | italic_z ) â‰ˆ âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_O ( 1 ) italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) (33)
âˆi=1nOâ¢(1)â¢pâ¢(ri|r1:iâˆ’1,z)=âˆi=1nâˆ‘hiâˆ’1dâˆˆğ’Ÿpâ¢(ri|hiâˆ’1d,z)â¢pâ¢(hiâˆ’1d|r1:iâˆ’1,z),superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘‚1ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–subscriptğ‘Ÿ:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘–1ğ‘‘ğ’Ÿğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–superscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘–1ğ‘‘ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘–1ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘Ÿ:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§\displaystyle\prod_{i=1}^{n}O(1)p(r_{i}|r_{1:i-1},z)=\prod_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{h_{i% -1}^{d}\in\mathcal{D}}p(r_{i}|h_{i-1}^{d},z)p(h_{i-1}^{d}|r_{1:i-1},z),âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_O ( 1 ) italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) = âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_D end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_z ) italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) , (34)

risubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–r_{i}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a passage in the retrieved texts list Rğ‘…Ritalic_R, hiâˆ’1dsuperscriptsubscriptâ„ğ‘–1ğ‘‘h_{i-1}^{d}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the hidden state for the delimiter between riâˆ’1subscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–1r_{i-1}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and risubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–r_{i}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Rğ‘…Ritalic_R. râ¢(z)=logâ¢pâ¢(R,x1:iâˆ’1|z)pâ¢(R,x1:iâˆ’1|zâˆ—)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§logğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§ğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§\displaystyle r(z)=\textrm{log}\frac{p(R,x_{1:i-1}|z)}{p(R,x_{1:i-1}|z^{*})}italic_r ( italic_z ) = log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG â‰ˆlogâ¢âˆi=1nOâ¢(1)â¢pâ¢(ri|z)âˆi=1nOâ¢(1)â¢pâ¢(ri|zâˆ—)absentlogsuperscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘‚1ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ‘‚1ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–superscriptğ‘§\displaystyle\approx\textrm{log}\frac{\prod_{i=1}^{n}O(1)p(r_{i}|z)}{\prod_{i=% 1}^{n}O(1)p(r_{i}|z^{*})}â‰ˆ log divide start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_O ( 1 ) italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_O ( 1 ) italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG (35)
â†’Oâ¢(1)+nâˆ—1nâ¢âˆ‘i=1nlâ¢oâ¢gâ¢pâ¢(ri|z)p(ri|zâˆ—)=Oâ¢(1)+nâˆ—ğ”¼râˆ¼Prâ¢[lâ¢oâ¢gâ¢pâ¢(ri|z)pâ¢(ri|zâˆ—)]\displaystyle\rightarrow O(1)+n*\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}log\frac{p(r_{i}|z)}{% p(r_{i}|z*)}=O(1)+n*\mathbb{E}_{r\sim P_{r}}\left[log\frac{p(r_{i}|z)}{p(r_{i}% |z^{*})}\right]â†’ italic_O ( 1 ) + italic_n âˆ— divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l italic_o italic_g divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z âˆ— ) end_ARG = italic_O ( 1 ) + italic_n âˆ— blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r âˆ¼ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_l italic_o italic_g divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ] (36)
âˆpRâ¢(r)â¢logâ¢pâ¢(r|z)pâ¢(r|zâˆ—)=pRâ¢(r)â¢logâ¢pRâ¢(r)pâ¢(r|zâˆ—)âˆ’pRâ¢(r)â¢logâ¢pRâ¢(r)pâ¢(r|z)proportional-toabsentsubscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿlogğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§subscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿlogsubscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§subscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿlogsubscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿğ‘§\displaystyle\propto p_{R}(r)\textrm{log}\frac{p(r|z)}{p(r|z^{*})}=p_{R}(r)% \textrm{log}\frac{p_{R}(r)}{p(r|z^{*})}-p_{R}(r)\textrm{log}\frac{p_{R}(r)}{p(% r|z)}âˆ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) end_ARG (37)
=âˆ’(KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âŸbenefit,denote asÂ â¢Î©âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))âŸdetriment,denote asÂ â¢Î¥),\displaystyle=-(\underbrace{\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))}_{\textbf{benefit},% \textrm{denote as }\Omega}-\underbrace{\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))}_{% \textbf{detriment},\textrm{denote as }\Upsilon}),= - ( underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT benefit , denote as roman_Î© end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT detriment , denote as roman_Î¥ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (38)

pRâ¢(â‹…)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…â‹…p_{R}(\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) is the distribution of the retrieved texts, pâ¢(â‹…)ğ‘â‹…p(\cdot)italic_p ( â‹… ) is the distribution of the LLMsâ€™ pre-trianed knowledge.

âˆ

Appendix C Effect of râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z ) in Knowledge Fusion

Recapping the EquationÂ 38, we find râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z ) actually regulates the proportion between LLMsâ€™ pre-trained knowledge and retrieved knowledge in knowledge fusion of RAG prediction:

  • â€¢

    The more benefit outweigh detriment, râ¢(z)â†’âˆ’âˆâ†’ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)\to-\inftyitalic_r ( italic_z ) â†’ - âˆ and exp(râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z )) â†’0â†’absent0\to 0â†’ 0 for all zâ‰ zâˆ—ğ‘§superscriptğ‘§z\neq z^{*}italic_z â‰  italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, this indicates that concepts zğ‘§zitalic_z sampled from LLMsâ€™ space contribute little to pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). When z=zâˆ—ğ‘§superscriptğ‘§z=z^{*}italic_z = italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, exp(râ¢(zâˆ—)ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§r(z^{*})italic_r ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )) =1absent1=1= 1, which means that latent variable model concentrates more on zâˆ—superscriptğ‘§z^{*}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sampled from retrieved texts. As râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z ) decreases, the proportion of retrieved knowledge in becomes larger and larger in fusion.

  • â€¢

    The more detriment outweigh benefit, râ¢(z)â†’+âˆâ†’ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)\to+\inftyitalic_r ( italic_z ) â†’ + âˆ and exp(râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z )) â†’+âˆâ†’absent\to+\inftyâ†’ + âˆ for all zâ‰ zâˆ—ğ‘§superscriptğ‘§z\neq z^{*}italic_z â‰  italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and when z=zâˆ—ğ‘§superscriptğ‘§z=z^{*}italic_z = italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, exp(râ¢(zâˆ—)ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§r(z^{*})italic_r ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )) =1absent1=1= 1. This indicates that concepts zğ‘§zitalic_z sampled from LLMsâ€™ space contribute more and more than zâˆ—superscriptğ‘§z^{*}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sampled from retrieved texts as râ¢(z)ğ‘Ÿğ‘§r(z)italic_r ( italic_z ) increases.

Appendix D Proof for TheoremÂ 1

Proof.

Recapping the EquationÂ 2 that describes the knowledge fusion in RAG via latent variable model:

pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)â¢pâ¢(z|R,x1:iâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘‘zâŸdenote asÂ â¢Î¦+pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,zâˆ—)â¢pâ¢(zâˆ—|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âŸdenote asÂ â¢Î›.absentsubscriptâŸsubscriptğ’µsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1differential-dğ‘§denote asÂ Î¦subscriptâŸğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1denote asÂ Î›\displaystyle=\underbrace{\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},z)% p(z|R,x_{1:i-1})\,dz}_{\textrm{denote as }\Phi}+\underbrace{p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1% },z^{*})p(z^{*}|R,x_{1:i-1})}_{\textrm{denote as }\Lambda}.= underâŸ start_ARG âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) italic_p ( italic_z | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_z end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote as roman_Î¦ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + underâŸ start_ARG italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote as roman_Î› end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (39)

Since latent concept zâˆ—superscriptğ‘§z^{*}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT determines the hidden states hâ„hitalic_h, Î›Î›\Lambdaroman_Î› can be transformed as:

Let pâ¢(zâˆ—|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(z^{*}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = Î²ğ›½\betaitalic_Î²:

pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =Î¦+Î²âˆ‘hp(xi|x1:iâˆ’1,h,zâˆ—)p(h|R,x1:iâˆ’1.zâˆ—)\displaystyle=\Phi+\beta\sum_{h}p(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1},h,z^{*})p(h|R,x_{1:i-1}.z^{*})= roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_h | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (41)
pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ‘hpâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1,h,zâˆ—)â¢pRâ¢(h|x1:iâˆ’1)absentsubscriptâ„ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1â„superscriptğ‘§subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalâ„subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle=\sum_{h}p(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1},h,z^{*})p_{R}(h|x_{1:i-1})= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (42)
pRâ¢(h|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalâ„subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p_{R}(h|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆpâ¢(x1:iâˆ’1|h,zâˆ—)â¢pRâ¢(h)proportional-toabsentğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1â„superscriptğ‘§subscriptğ‘ğ‘…â„\displaystyle\propto p(x_{1:i-1}|h,z^{*})p_{R}(h)âˆ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h ) (43)
pâ¢(h|R,x1:iâˆ’1,zâˆ—)ğ‘conditionalâ„ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§\displaystyle p(h|R,x_{1:i-1},z^{*})italic_p ( italic_h | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆpâ¢(x1:iâˆ’1|h,zâˆ—)â¢pâ¢(h|R,zâˆ—)proportional-toabsentğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1â„superscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalâ„ğ‘…superscriptğ‘§\displaystyle\propto p(x_{1:i-1}|h,z^{*})p(h|R,z^{*})âˆ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_h | italic_R , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (44)

let probabilities pâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1,h,zâˆ—)â¢pâ¢(x1:iâˆ’1|h,zâˆ—)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1â„superscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1â„superscriptğ‘§p(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1},h,z^{*})p(x_{1:i-1}|h,z^{*})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_h , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) in EquationÂ 40 is represented as matrix Wâˆˆâ„|ğ’³|Ã—|â„‹|ğ‘Šsuperscriptâ„ğ’³â„‹W\in\mathbb{R}^{|\mathcal{X}|\times|\mathcal{H}|}italic_W âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_X | Ã— | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for all possible xiâˆˆğ’³subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ’³x_{i}\in\mathcal{X}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_X and hâˆˆâ„‹â„â„‹h\in\mathcal{H}italic_h âˆˆ caligraphic_H, pâ¢(h|R,zâˆ—)ğ‘conditionalâ„ğ‘…superscriptğ‘§p(h|R,z^{*})italic_p ( italic_h | italic_R , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) in EquationÂ 44 is matrix BğµBitalic_B, pRâ¢(h)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…â„p_{R}(h)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h ) in EquationÂ 43 is uâˆˆâ„|â„‹|ğ‘¢superscriptâ„â„‹u\in\mathbb{R}^{|\mathcal{H}|}italic_u âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. We use 1-norm to calculate the difference between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), which can be formalized as:

âˆ¥p(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ’pR(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ¥1=âˆ¥Î¦+Î²WBâˆ’Wuâˆ¥1.\displaystyle\|p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})-p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})\|_{1}=\|\Phi+\beta WB% -Wu\|_{1}.âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (45)

Then, according to the triangle inequality of 1-norm, the difference between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is bouned by:

â€–Î¦â€–1âˆ’â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1â‰¤â€–Î¦+Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1â‰¤â€–Î¦â€–1+â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1.subscriptnormÎ¦1subscriptnormğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1subscriptnormÎ¦ğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1subscriptnormÎ¦1subscriptnormğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1\displaystyle\|\Phi\|_{1}-\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}\leq\|\Phi+\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}\leq% \|\Phi\|_{1}+\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}.âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (46)

We consider to further analyze â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1subscriptnormğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1subscriptnormğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1\displaystyle\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =âˆ‘i=1|ğ’³||WiTâ¢(Î²â¢Bâˆ’u)|iabsentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ’³subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘–ğ‘‡ğ›½ğµğ‘¢ğ‘–\displaystyle=\sum_{i=1}^{|\mathcal{X}|}|W_{i}^{T}(\beta B-u)|_{i}= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_X | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (47)
=âˆ‘i=1|ğ’³||âˆ‘j=1|â„‹|Wiâ¢jâ¢(Î²â¢Bâˆ’u)j|absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ’³superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1â„‹subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ›½ğµğ‘¢ğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum_{i=1}^{|\mathcal{X}|}|\sum_{j=1}^{|\mathcal{H}|}W_{ij}(% \beta B-u)_{j}|= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_X | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | (48)
â‰¤âˆ‘i=1|ğ’³|âˆ‘j=1|â„‹|Wiâ¢jâ¢|(Î²â¢Bâˆ’u)j|absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ’³superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1â„‹subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ›½ğµğ‘¢ğ‘—\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i=1}^{|\mathcal{X}|}\sum_{j=1}^{|\mathcal{H}|}W_{ij}|(% \beta B-u)_{j}|â‰¤ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_X | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ( italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | (49)
=âˆ‘j=1|â„‹|(âˆ‘i=1|ğ’³|Wiâ¢j)â¢|(Î²â¢Bâˆ’u)j|absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1â„‹superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ’³subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ›½ğµğ‘¢ğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum_{j=1}^{|\mathcal{H}|}(\sum_{i=1}^{|\mathcal{X}|}W_{ij})|(% \beta B-u)_{j}|= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_X | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ( italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | (50)
=âˆ‘j=1|â„‹||(Î²â¢Bâˆ’u)j|absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1â„‹subscriptğ›½ğµğ‘¢ğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum_{j=1}^{|\mathcal{H}|}|(\beta B-u)_{j}|= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_H | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ( italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | (51)
=â€–Î²â¢Bâˆ’uâ€–1absentsubscriptnormğ›½ğµğ‘¢1\displaystyle=\|\beta B-u\|_{1}= âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (52)

Then:

â€–Î²â¢Bâˆ’uâ€–1subscriptnormğ›½ğµğ‘¢1\displaystyle\|\beta B-u\|_{1}âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_B - italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =2TV(pR(â‹…),Î²p(â‹…|R,zâˆ—))Â TV is Total Variation Distance.\displaystyle=2TV(p_{R}(\cdot),\beta p(\cdot|R,z^{*}))\text{\quad TV is Total % Variation Distance.}= 2 italic_T italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) , italic_Î² italic_p ( â‹… | italic_R , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) TV is Total Variation Distance. (53)
â‰¤2Î²TV(pR(â‹…),p(â‹…|R,zâˆ—))\displaystyle\leq 2\beta TV(p_{R}(\cdot),p(\cdot|R,z^{*}))â‰¤ 2 italic_Î² italic_T italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) , italic_p ( â‹… | italic_R , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (54)
â‰¤2KL(pR(â‹…)âˆ¥p(â‹…|R,zâˆ—))â¢Â Pinskerâ€™s Inequality.\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(\cdot)\|p(\cdot|R,z^{*}))}\text{\quad Pinsker% 's Inequality.}â‰¤ square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( â‹… | italic_R , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG Pinskerâ€™s Inequality. (55)
â‰¤2KL(pR(â‹…)âˆ¥p(â‹…|zâˆ—))\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(\cdot)\|p(\cdot|z^{*}))}â‰¤ square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( â‹… | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG (56)
â‰ˆ2KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)),\displaystyle\approx\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))},â‰ˆ square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG , (57)

in which rğ‘Ÿritalic_r is the passage in Rğ‘…Ritalic_R, KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) is actually the detrimentin EquationÂ 9. Recapping EquationÂ 46, we can get:

â€–Î¦+Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1â‰¤â€–Î¦â€–1+2KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))\displaystyle\|\Phi+\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}\leq\|\Phi\|_{1}+\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(r% )\|p(r|z^{*}))}âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG (58)

Since 0â‰¤â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1â‰¤2â¢2KL(pR(â‹…)âˆ¥p(â‹…|zâˆ—))0\leq\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}\leq 2\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(\cdot)\|p(\cdot|z^{*}))}0 â‰¤ âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 2 square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( â‹… | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG and â€–Î¦+Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1â‰¥â€–Î¦â€–1âˆ’â€–Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1subscriptnormÎ¦ğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1subscriptnormÎ¦1subscriptnormğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1\|\Phi+\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}\geq\|\Phi\|_{1}-\|\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - âˆ¥ italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then the lower bound for â€–Î¦+Î²â¢Wâ¢Bâˆ’Wâ¢uâ€–1subscriptnormÎ¦ğ›½ğ‘Šğµğ‘Šğ‘¢1\|\Phi+\beta WB-Wu\|_{1}âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ + italic_Î² italic_W italic_B - italic_W italic_u âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is included in:

[â€–Î¦â€–1âˆ’2KL(pR(â‹…)âˆ¥p(â‹…|zâˆ—)),â€–Î¦â€–1],\displaystyle\left[\|\Phi\|_{1}-\sqrt{2\text{KL}(p_{R}(\cdot)\|p(\cdot|z^{*}))% },\|\Phi\|_{1}\right],[ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - square-root start_ARG 2 KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( â‹… | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG , âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , (59)

we take the minimum value as the lower bound. Define ğ’Ÿ=âˆ¥p(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ’pR(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ¥1\mathcal{D}=\|p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})-p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})\|_{1}caligraphic_D = âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the difference between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), according to EquationÂ 45 andÂ 46, the lower and upper bound for ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D is:

â€–Î¦â€–1âˆ’2â¢KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))âŸdetrimentâ‰¤ğ’Ÿâ‰¤â€–Î¦â€–1+2â¢KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))âŸdetriment,\displaystyle\|\Phi\|_{1}-\sqrt{2\underbrace{\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))}_% {\textbf{detriment}}}\leq\mathcal{D}\leq\|\Phi\|_{1}+\sqrt{2\underbrace{\text{% KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))}_{\textbf{detriment}}},âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - square-root start_ARG 2 underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT detriment end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG â‰¤ caligraphic_D â‰¤ âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + square-root start_ARG 2 underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT detriment end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , (60)

For ease of description, we denote benefit KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z)\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z)KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) as Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© and denote detriment KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*})KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) as Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥. Recapping EquationÂ 5 andÂ 9:

Î¦Î¦\Phiroman_Î¦ in EquationÂ 60 can be transformed as:

Î¦Î¦\displaystyle\Phiroman_Î¦ =âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)â¢pâ¢(z|R,x1:iâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘‘zabsentsubscriptğ’µsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1differential-dğ‘§\displaystyle=\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},z)p(z|R,x_{1:i% -1})\,dz= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) italic_p ( italic_z | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_z (61)
=pâ¢(R,x1:iâˆ’1|zâˆ—)pâ¢(R,x1:iâˆ’1)â¢âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)â¢expâ¢(râ¢(z))â¢pâ¢(z)â¢ğ‘‘zabsentğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§ğ‘ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1subscriptğ’µsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§expğ‘Ÿğ‘§ğ‘ğ‘§differential-dğ‘§\displaystyle=\frac{p(R,x_{1:i-1}|z^{*})}{p(R,x_{1:i-1})}\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{% z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},z)\textrm{exp}(r(z))p(z)\,dz= divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) exp ( italic_r ( italic_z ) ) italic_p ( italic_z ) italic_d italic_z (62)

Now the TheoremÂ 1 has been proven.

âˆ

Appendix E Proof for TheoremÂ 2

In this section, we try to prove that the gap between values of benefit and detriment is approximately positively correlated with the similarity (1ğ’Ÿ1ğ’Ÿ\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG) between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). To achieve this, we can start from EquationÂ 60 to prove that the gap between values of benefit and detriment is negatively correlated with the difference (ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D) between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), which is actually the reciprocal of similarity (1ğ’Ÿ1ğ’Ÿ\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG). Specifically, we want to prove that the gap between values of benefit and detriment (KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z)âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z)-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*})KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )) is negatively correlated with both lower and upper bound in EquationÂ 60. For ease of description, we denote benefit KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z)\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z)KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) as Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© and denote detriment KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*})KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) as Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥.

Proof.

Recapping EquationÂ 5 andÂ 9:

pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)â¢pâ¢(z|R,x1:iâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘‘zâŸdenote asÂ â¢Î¦+pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,zâˆ—)â¢pâ¢(zâˆ—|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âŸdenote asÂ â¢Î›.absentsubscriptâŸsubscriptğ’µsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1differential-dğ‘§denote asÂ Î¦subscriptâŸğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1superscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1denote asÂ Î›\displaystyle=\underbrace{\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},z)% p(z|R,x_{1:i-1})\,dz}_{\textrm{denote as }\Phi}+\underbrace{p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1% },z^{*})p(z^{*}|R,x_{1:i-1})}_{\textrm{denote as }\Lambda}.= underâŸ start_ARG âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) italic_p ( italic_z | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_z end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote as roman_Î¦ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + underâŸ start_ARG italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote as roman_Î› end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Î¦Î¦\Phiroman_Î¦ in EquationÂ 60 can be transformed as:

â‰ˆÎ±â¢âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)â¢expâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))â¢pâ¢(z)â¢ğ‘‘zÂ (EquationÂ 9).absentğ›¼subscriptğ’µsuperscriptğ‘§ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1ğ‘§expÎ©Î¥ğ‘ğ‘§differential-dğ‘§Â (EquationÂ 9)\displaystyle\approx\alpha\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},z)% \textrm{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))p(z)\,dz\quad\textrm{ (Equation~{}\ref{eq4})}.â‰ˆ italic_Î± âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) italic_p ( italic_z ) italic_d italic_z (Equation ) . Therefore, the lower bound of EquationÂ 60 is:

â€–Î¦â€–1âˆ’2â¢Î¥subscriptnormÎ¦12Î¥\displaystyle\|\Phi\|_{1}-\sqrt{2\Upsilon}âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG â‰ˆÎ±âˆ¥âˆ«ğ’µâˆ’{zâˆ—}p(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1,z)exp(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))p(z)dzâˆ¥1âˆ’2â¢Î¥\displaystyle\approx\alpha\|\int_{\mathcal{Z}-\{{z}^{*}\}}p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1},% z)\textrm{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))p(z)\,dz\|_{1}-\sqrt{2\Upsilon}â‰ˆ italic_Î± âˆ¥ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Z - { italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ) exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) italic_p ( italic_z ) italic_d italic_z âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG (69)
âˆexpâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))âˆ’2â¢Î¥proportional-toabsentexpÎ©Î¥2Î¥\displaystyle\propto\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))-\sqrt{2\Upsilon}âˆ exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) - square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG (70)

and the upper bound of EquationÂ 60 is:

â€–Î¦â€–1+2â¢Î¥subscriptnormÎ¦12Î¥\displaystyle\|\Phi\|_{1}+\sqrt{2\Upsilon}âˆ¥ roman_Î¦ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG âˆexpâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))+2â¢Î¥proportional-toabsentexpÎ©Î¥2Î¥\displaystyle\propto\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))+\sqrt{2\Upsilon}âˆ exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) + square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG (71)

Due to both Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© and Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥ being variables, analyzing the result of subtraction between Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© and Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥ under their simultaneous changes is complex. Therefore, we use the â€œSeparation of variablesâ€œ to simplify our analysis. Specifically, we first assume that one is constant, and then analyze the changes caused by the variation of another:

  • â€¢

    Assume Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© is constant, as the value of Î©âˆ’Î¥Î©Î¥\Omega-\Upsilonroman_Î© - roman_Î¥ increases, Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥ decreases and the upper bound expâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))+2â¢Î¥expÎ©Î¥2Î¥\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))+\sqrt{2\Upsilon}exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) + square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG also deceases. In the lower bound expâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))âˆ’2â¢Î¥expÎ©Î¥2Î¥\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))-\sqrt{2\Upsilon}exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) - square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG, since the first term is an exponential function and the second term is a square root function, a decrease of Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥ leads to the decrease in the entire lower bound. Therefore, both lower and upper bounds in EquationÂ 60 decrease as Î©âˆ’Î¥Î©Î¥\Omega-\Upsilonroman_Î© - roman_Î¥ increases.

  • â€¢

    Assume Î¥Î¥\Upsilonroman_Î¥ is constant, as the value of Î©âˆ’Î¥Î©Î¥\Omega-\Upsilonroman_Î© - roman_Î¥ increases, Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© increases and the upper bound expâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))+2â¢Î¥expÎ©Î¥2Î¥\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))+\sqrt{2\Upsilon}exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) + square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG deceases. In the lower bound expâ¢(âˆ’(Î©âˆ’Î¥))âˆ’2â¢Î¥expÎ©Î¥2Î¥\text{exp}(-(\Omega-\Upsilon))-\sqrt{2\Upsilon}exp ( - ( roman_Î© - roman_Î¥ ) ) - square-root start_ARG 2 roman_Î¥ end_ARG, since the first term is an exponential function and the second term is a square root function, an increase of Î©Î©\Omegaroman_Î© leads to the decrease in the entire lower bound. Therefore, both lower and upper bounds in EquationÂ 60 decrease as Î©âˆ’Î¥Î©Î¥\Omega-\Upsilonroman_Î© - roman_Î¥ increases.

On behalf of the analysis above, we can derve that both lower and upper bounds in EquationÂ 60 are approximately negatively correlated with the gap between values of benefit and detriment. Therefore, the difference ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is approximately negatively correlated with the gap between values of benefit and detriment. In other words, 1D1ğ·\frac{1}{D}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_D end_ARG can be treated as the similarity between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and it is approximately positively correlated with the gap between values of benefit and detriment.:

KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âŸbenefitâˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))âŸdetrimentâˆ1ğ’Ÿ.\underbrace{\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))}_{\textbf{benefit}}-\underbrace{\text{% KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))}_{\textbf{detriment}}\propto\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}.underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT benefit end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - underâŸ start_ARG KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT detriment end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG . (72)

So we have proved that the gap between values of benefit and detriment is approximately positively correlated with 1D1ğ·\frac{1}{D}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_D end_ARG.

âˆ

Appendix F Proof for TheoremÂ 3

This section aims to prove:

J={KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))<KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)), detriment outweighs benefit.ifÂ â¢1ğ’Ÿ<1â„³KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))=KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)), detriment is equal to benefit.ifÂ â¢1ğ’Ÿ=1â„³KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))>KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—)), benefit outweighs detriment.ifÂ â¢1ğ’Ÿ>1â„³\displaystyle J=\begin{cases}\textnormal{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))<\textnormal{KL}% (p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))\text{, detriment outweighs benefit.}&\text{if }\frac{1}% {\mathcal{D}}<\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}\\ \textnormal{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))=\textnormal{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))\text{,% detriment is equal to benefit.}&\text{if }\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}=\frac{1}{% \mathcal{M}}\\ \textnormal{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))>\textnormal{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))\text{,% benefit outweighs detriment.}&\text{if }\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}>\frac{1}{% \mathcal{M}}\end{cases}italic_J = { start_ROW start_CELL KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) < KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) , detriment outweighs benefit. end_CELL start_CELL if divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG < divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) = KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) , detriment is equal to benefit. end_CELL start_CELL if divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) > KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) , benefit outweighs detriment. end_CELL start_CELL if divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW (73)

in which 1â„³1â„³\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG is the similarity between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (LLMsâ€™ pre-trained knowledge), 1ğ’Ÿ1ğ’Ÿ\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG is the similarity between pâ¢(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–ğ‘…subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (distribution of retrieved texts)

Proof.

When benefit is equal to detriment:

KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))=0,\displaystyle\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))=0,KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = 0 , (74)

which means that:

pRâ¢(r)â¢logâ¢pâ¢(r|z)pâ¢(r|zâˆ—)=0,subscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿlogğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿğ‘§ğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§0\displaystyle p_{R}(r)\textrm{log}\frac{p(r|z)}{p(r|z^{*})}=0,italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG = 0 , (75)

since pRâ¢(r)subscriptğ‘ğ‘…ğ‘Ÿp_{R}(r)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) cannot be 00, then:

logâ¢pâ¢(r|z)p(r|zâˆ—)\displaystyle\textrm{log}\frac{p(r|z)}{p(r|z*)}log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z âˆ— ) end_ARG =0,absent0\displaystyle=0,= 0 , (76)
pâ¢(r|z)p(r|zâˆ—)\displaystyle\frac{p(r|z)}{p(r|z*)}divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z âˆ— ) end_ARG =1,absent1\displaystyle=1,= 1 , (77)
pâ¢(r|z)ğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿğ‘§\displaystyle p(r|z)italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) =pâ¢(r|zâˆ—),absentğ‘conditionalğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘§\displaystyle=p(r|z^{*}),= italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (78)

Recapping EquationÂ 2 that zâˆ—superscriptğ‘§z^{*}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is sampled from retrieved texts and zğ‘§zitalic_z is sampled from LLMsâ€™ pre-trained knowledge, EquationÂ 78 indicates that the knowledge of retrieved texts has been involved in LLLsâ€™ pre-trained knowledge, so:

pâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1)=pRâ¢(xi|x1:iâˆ’1),ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1subscriptğ‘ğ‘…conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥:1ğ‘–1\displaystyle p(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1})=p_{R}(x_{i}|x_{1:i-1}),italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (79)

then:

âˆ¥p(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ’p(xiâˆ¥x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ¥1=âˆ¥p(xi|R,x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ’pR(xiâˆ¥x1:iâˆ’1)âˆ¥1,\displaystyle\|p(x_{i}|R,x_{1:i-1})-p(x_{i}\|x_{1:i-1})\|_{1}=\|p(x_{i}|R,x_{1% :i-1})-p_{R}(x_{i}\|x_{1:i-1})\|_{1},âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_R , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (80)

which means that 1ğ’Ÿ=1â„³1ğ’Ÿ1â„³\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}=\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG is an important dividing point. When 1ğ’Ÿ=1â„³1ğ’Ÿ1â„³\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}=\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG, we can get that benefit is equal to detriment and KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))=0\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))=0KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = 0. EquationÂ 72 indicates that the gap between values of benefit and detriment (KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )) is approximately positively correlated with 1ğ’Ÿ1ğ’Ÿ\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG. Therefore, when 1ğ’Ÿ>1â„³1ğ’Ÿ1â„³\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}>\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG we can get that benefit outweighs detriment (KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))>0\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))>0KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) > 0). When 1ğ’Ÿ<1â„³1ğ’Ÿ1â„³\frac{1}{\mathcal{D}}<\frac{1}{\mathcal{M}}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG < divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG caligraphic_M end_ARG we can get that detriment outweighs benefit (KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|z))âˆ’KL(pR(r)âˆ¥p(r|zâˆ—))<0\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z))-\text{KL}(p_{R}(r)\|p(r|z^{*}))<0KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z ) ) - KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r ) âˆ¥ italic_p ( italic_r | italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) < 0). Now the proof of TheoremÂ 3 has been finished. âˆ

Appendix G Proof for RAG is actually unsupervised In-context Learning

This section aims to prove that RAG is actually unsupervised ICL from two perspectives. One is that previous studies find that ICL performs gradient descent as meta-optimizerÂ VonÂ Oswald etÂ al. [2023], AkyÃ¼rek etÂ al. [2022], Dai etÂ al. [2022]. We prove that in this perspective, the distribution of texts in context drives the learning even without explicit input-output supervision. Therefore, the distribution of unsupervised retrieved texts in RAG, which is actually the distribution of context for query, can also drives the learning. Then we can prove that RAG is actually unsupervised in-context learning. The specific proof is:

Proof.

From the perspective that ICL performs gradient descent as meta-optimizers, ICL can be formalized as the following:

Gradient descent in optimization of linear layers have a dual form of linear attentionÂ Irie etÂ al. [2022], Aizerman etÂ al. [1964], define a liner layer as:

fâ¢(x)=W0â¢x,ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘Š0ğ‘¥\displaystyle f(x)=W_{0}x,italic_f ( italic_x ) = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x , (81)

in which W0subscriptğ‘Š0W_{0}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the initial weight matrix. Given a sequence of historical input vectors ğ±ğ¢âˆˆâ„diâ¢nsubscriptğ±ğ¢superscriptâ„subscriptğ‘‘ğ‘–ğ‘›\mathbf{x_{i}}\in\mathbb{R}^{d_{in}}bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and corresponding error signals ğğ¢âˆˆâ„doâ¢uâ¢tsubscriptğğ¢superscriptâ„subscriptğ‘‘ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘¡\mathbf{e_{i}}\in\mathbb{R}^{d_{out}}bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_u italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, iâˆˆ[1,N]ğ‘–1ğ‘i\in[1,N]italic_i âˆˆ [ 1 , italic_N ] obtained by gradient descent, the update of the weight matrix can be represented as:

Wâ€²=W0+Î”â¢W=W0+âˆ‘iNğğ¢âŠ—ğ±ğ¢.superscriptğ‘Šâ€²subscriptğ‘Š0Î”ğ‘Šsubscriptğ‘Š0superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘tensor-productsubscriptğğ¢subscriptğ±ğ¢\displaystyle W^{\prime}=W_{0}+\Delta W=W_{0}+\sum_{i}^{N}\mathbf{e_{i}}% \otimes\mathbf{x_{i}}.italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_W = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ— bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (82)

Recap that the linear attention can be formulated as:

LinearAttnâ¢(V,K,ğª)=âˆ‘iğ¯iâ¢(ğ¤iTâ¢ğª).LinearAttnğ‘‰ğ¾ğªsubscriptğ‘–subscriptğ¯ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ¤ğ‘‡ğ‘–ğª\displaystyle\text{LinearAttn}(V,K,\mathbf{q})=\sum_{i}\mathbf{v}_{i}(\mathbf{% k}^{T}_{i}\mathbf{q}).LinearAttn ( italic_V , italic_K , bold_q ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_q ) . (83)

Then the dual form of updated linear layer with new input ğ±N+1subscriptğ±ğ‘1\mathbf{x}_{N+1}bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is:

fâ€²â¢(x)superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¥\displaystyle f^{\prime}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x ) =(W0+Î”â¢W)â¢ğ±N+1absentsubscriptğ‘Š0Î”ğ‘Šsubscriptğ±ğ‘1\displaystyle=(W_{0}+\Delta W)\mathbf{x}_{N+1}= ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_W ) bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (84)
=(W0+âˆ‘iNğiâŠ—ğ±i)â¢ğ±N+1absentsubscriptğ‘Š0superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘tensor-productsubscriptğğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘1\displaystyle=(W_{0}+\sum_{i}^{N}\mathbf{e}_{i}\otimes\mathbf{x}_{i})\mathbf{x% }_{N+1}= ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ— bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (85)
=W0â¢ğ±N+1+âˆ‘iN(ğiâŠ—ğ±i)â¢ğ±N+1absentsubscriptğ‘Š0subscriptğ±ğ‘1superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘tensor-productsubscriptğğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘–subscriptğ±ğ‘1\displaystyle=W_{0}\mathbf{x}_{N+1}+\sum_{i}^{N}(\mathbf{e}_{i}\otimes\mathbf{% x}_{i})\mathbf{x}_{N+1}= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ— bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (86)
=W0â¢ğ±N+1+âˆ‘iNğiâŠ—(ğ±iTâ¢ğ±N+1)absentsubscriptğ‘Š0subscriptğ±ğ‘1superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘tensor-productsubscriptğğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ‘‡subscriptğ±ğ‘1\displaystyle=W_{0}\mathbf{x}_{N+1}+\sum_{i}^{N}\mathbf{e}_{i}\otimes(\mathbf{% x}_{i}^{T}\mathbf{x}_{N+1})= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ— ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (87)
=W0â¢ğ±N+1+LinearAttnâ¢(E,ğ±1:N,ğ±N+1)absentsubscriptğ‘Š0subscriptğ±ğ‘1LinearAttnğ¸subscriptğ±:1ğ‘subscriptğ±ğ‘1\displaystyle=W_{0}\mathbf{x}_{N+1}+\text{LinearAttn}(E,\mathbf{x}_{1:N},% \mathbf{x}_{N+1})= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + LinearAttn ( italic_E , bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (88)

In in-context learning, the attention of a head is:

fIâ¢Câ¢Lâ¢(ğª)subscriptğ‘“ğ¼ğ¶ğ¿ğª\displaystyle f_{ICL}(\mathbf{q})italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I italic_C italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_q ) =Attnâ¢(V,K,ğª)absentAttnğ‘‰ğ¾ğª\displaystyle=\text{Attn}(V,K,\mathbf{q})= Attn ( italic_V , italic_K , bold_q ) (89)
=WV[Bâ€²:B]softmax(WK[Bâ€²:B]Tğªd),\displaystyle=W_{V}[B^{\prime}:B]\text{softmax}\left(\frac{W_{K}[B^{\prime}:B]% ^{T}\mathbf{q}}{\sqrt{d}}\right),= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_B ] softmax ( divide start_ARG italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_B ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_d end_ARG end_ARG ) , (90)

in which ğª=WQâ¢ğ›ğªsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘„ğ›\mathbf{q}=W_{Q}\mathbf{b}bold_q = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b, ğ›ğ›\mathbf{b}bold_b is the input tğ‘¡titalic_t-th token in query, WQsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘„W_{Q}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, WKsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾W_{K}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Wvsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘£W_{v}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are projection matrices, Bâ€²superscriptğµâ€²B^{\prime}italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is demonstrations of the context and Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X is the prefix for ğ›ğ›\mathbf{b}bold_b of the query. To simplify qualitative analysis, we followÂ Dai etÂ al. [2022] to estimate the standard attention as relaxed linear attention, achieved by eliminating the softmax function and the scaling factor:

fIâ¢Câ¢Lâ¢(ğª)subscriptğ‘“ğ¼ğ¶ğ¿ğª\displaystyle f_{ICL}(\mathbf{q})italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I italic_C italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_q ) â‰ˆWV[Bâ€²:B](WK[Bâ€²:B])Tğª\displaystyle\approx W_{V}[B^{\prime}:B](W_{K}[B^{\prime}:B])^{T}\mathbf{q}â‰ˆ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_B ] ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : italic_B ] ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q (91)
=WVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢B)Tâ¢ğª+WVâ¢Xâ€²â¢(WKâ¢Bâ€²)Tâ¢ğªabsentsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğµğ‘‡ğªsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptğ‘‹â€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptğµâ€²ğ‘‡ğª\displaystyle=W_{V}B(W_{K}B)^{T}\mathbf{q}+W_{V}X^{\prime}(W_{K}B^{\prime})^{T% }\mathbf{q}= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q + italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q (92)
=WVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢B)Tâ¢ğª+LinearAttnâ¢(WVâ¢Bâ€²,WKâ¢Bâ€²,ğª)absentsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğµğ‘‡ğªLinearAttnsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptğµâ€²subscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptğµâ€²ğª\displaystyle=W_{V}B(W_{K}B)^{T}\mathbf{q}+\text{LinearAttn}(W_{V}B^{\prime},W% _{K}B^{\prime},\mathbf{q})= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q + LinearAttn ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_q ) (93)

According to EquationÂ 88, the dual form of the Transformer attention is:

fIâ¢Câ¢Lâ¢(ğª)subscriptğ‘“ğ¼ğ¶ğ¿ğª\displaystyle f_{ICL}(\mathbf{q})italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I italic_C italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_q ) â‰ˆWVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢X)Tâ¢ğª+LinearAttnâ¢(WVâ¢Bâ€²,WKâ¢Bâ€²,ğª)absentsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğ‘‹ğ‘‡ğªLinearAttnsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptğµâ€²subscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptğµâ€²ğª\displaystyle\approx W_{V}B(W_{K}X)^{T}\mathbf{q}+\text{LinearAttn}(W_{V}B^{% \prime},W_{K}B^{\prime},\mathbf{q})â‰ˆ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q + LinearAttn ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_q ) (94)
=WVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢B)Tâ¢ğª+âˆ‘iWVâ¢ğ›iâ€²â¢((WKâ¢ğ›iâ€²)Tâ¢ğª)absentsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğµğ‘‡ğªsubscriptğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰subscriptsuperscriptğ›â€²ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾subscriptsuperscriptğ›â€²ğ‘–ğ‘‡ğª\displaystyle=W_{V}B(W_{K}B)^{T}\mathbf{q}+\sum_{i}W_{V}\mathbf{b}^{\prime}_{i% }\left((W_{K}\mathbf{b}^{\prime}_{i})^{T}\mathbf{q}\right)= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q ) (95)
=WVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢B)Tâ¢ğª+âˆ‘i((WVâ¢ğ›iâ€²)âŠ—(WKâ¢ğ›iâ€²))â¢ğª.absentsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğµğ‘‡ğªsubscriptğ‘–tensor-productsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰subscriptsuperscriptğ›â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ¾subscriptsuperscriptğ›â€²ğ‘–ğª\displaystyle=W_{V}B(W_{K}B)^{T}\mathbf{q}+\sum_{i}\left((W_{V}\mathbf{b}^{% \prime}_{i})\otimes(W_{K}\mathbf{b}^{\prime}_{i})\right)\mathbf{q}.= italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_q + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âŠ— ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) bold_q . (96)

Based on above derivation, we have this finding: comparing EquationÂ 86 with EquationÂ 96, we find that WVâ¢Bâ¢(WKâ¢B)Tsubscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘Šğ¾ğµğ‘‡W_{V}B(W_{K}B)^{T}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is equal to the initial weight matrix W0subscriptğ‘Š0W_{0}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is zero-shot prediction give query prefix BğµBitalic_B without demonstrations in the context. Besides, WVâ¢ğ›iâ€²subscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²W_{V}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is equal to ğisubscriptğğ‘–\mathbf{e}_{i}bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. which is the meta-gradient used to update the weighted matrix. WKâ¢ğ›isubscriptğ‘Šğ¾subscriptğ›ğ‘–W_{K}\mathbf{b}_{i}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is equal to the historical input vectors:

WVâ¢ğ›iâ€²subscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²\displaystyle W_{V}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =ğiabsentsubscriptğğ‘–\displaystyle=\mathbf{e}_{i}= bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (97)
WKâ¢ğ›iâ€²subscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²\displaystyle W_{K}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =xi.absentsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–\displaystyle=x_{i}.= italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (98)

In the standard gradient descent with loss â„’â„’\mathcal{L}caligraphic_L, ei=âˆ’Î·â¢âˆ‚â„’âˆ‚yisubscriptğ‘’ğ‘–ğœ‚â„’subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘–e_{i}=-\eta\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial y_{i}}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - italic_Î· divide start_ARG âˆ‚ caligraphic_L end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‚ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG and Î·ğœ‚\etaitalic_Î· is the learning rate and yi=Wiâ¢xisubscriptğ‘¦ğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–y_{i}=W_{i}x_{i}italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the output of the linear layer using the weight matrix Wisubscriptğ‘Šğ‘–W_{i}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at step tğ‘¡titalic_tÂ Irie etÂ al. [2022]. So we can get:

ği=âˆ’Î·â¢âˆ‚â„’âˆ‚yisubscriptğğ‘–ğœ‚â„’subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘–\displaystyle\mathbf{e}_{i}=-\eta\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial y_{i}}bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - italic_Î· divide start_ARG âˆ‚ caligraphic_L end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‚ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG =âˆ’Î·â¢âˆ‚â„’âˆ‚Wiâ¢xiabsentğœ‚â„’subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–\displaystyle=-\eta\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial W_{i}x_{i}}= - italic_Î· divide start_ARG âˆ‚ caligraphic_L end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‚ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG (99)
=âˆ’Î·â¢âˆ‚â„’âˆ‚Wiâ¢WKâ¢ğ›iâ€².absentğœ‚â„’subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²\displaystyle=-\eta\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial W_{i}W_{K}\mathbf{b}_{i% }^{\prime}}.= - italic_Î· divide start_ARG âˆ‚ caligraphic_L end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‚ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG . (100)

Therefore:

âˆ’Î·â¢âˆ‚â„’âˆ‚Wiâ¢WKâ¢ğ›iâ€²=WVâ¢ğ›iâ€².ğœ‚â„’subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ¾subscriptsuperscriptğ›â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²\displaystyle-\eta\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial W_{i}W_{K}\mathbf{b}^{% \prime}_{i}}=W_{V}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime}.- italic_Î· divide start_ARG âˆ‚ caligraphic_L end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‚ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (101)

So the loss â„’â„’\mathcal{L}caligraphic_L ca be represented as:

â„’=âˆ’1Î·â¢âˆ«WVâ¢ğ›iâ€²â¢dâ¢(Wiâ¢WKâ¢ğ›iâ€²)â„’1ğœ‚subscriptğ‘Šğ‘‰superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘Šğ‘–subscriptğ‘Šğ¾superscriptsubscriptğ›ğ‘–â€²\displaystyle\mathcal{L}=-\frac{1}{\eta}\int W_{V}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime}\,d(W% _{i}W_{K}\mathbf{b}_{i}^{\prime})caligraphic_L = - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î· end_ARG âˆ« italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (102)

EquationÂ 97 andÂ 102 show that the supervision signal, both loss and gradient, are directly related to the semantic representation of the tokens (bisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–b_{i}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) in the demonstration of context. This suggests that the distribution of the text in context is a direct learning signal for in-context learning, without the need for explicit input-output pairs in the demonstration. From the perspective that ICL performs gradient descent as meta-optimizer, the proof has been finished.

The other pespective is from our theoretical results in EquationÂ 5 andÂ 9 that:
